description: Voor een klant van mij ben ik opzoek naar een Data Engineer. Als Data Engineer ben je voortdurend bezig om het landschap van Big Data optimaal toegankelijk te maken voor Data Scientists en/of Data Analisten. De Data Engineer ontwikkelt complexe queries, niet alleen met het oog op het toegankelijk maken vanuit diverse bronnen maar ook om het genereren en presenteren van de data zo soepel en adequaat mogelijk te laten verlopen. Zo zijn Data Scientists en Analisten maximaal gefocust op de daadwerkelijke analyse. Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor; Vinden van juiste interne/externe databronnen om aan datavraag te voldoen; Combineren en opschonen van data uit verschillende bronnen en deze geschikt maken voor analyse; Waar nodig zorgen voor afscherming van persoonsgegevens in datasets (bijvoorbeeld door maskering, pseudonimisering of anonimisering); Bouwen van data pipelines naar het data lake. Het team van Data Engineers werkt via agile/scrum. Je kunt snel nieuwe dingen leren en flexibel mee veranderen in onze dynamische organisatie. Je hebt lef, een hoog energie niveau en een enthousiaste, positieve instelling. Je herkent jezelf verder in de onderstaande beschrijvingen: Afgeronde opleiding op minimaal HBO niveau (Computer Science, Informatica, of vergelijkbaar); Relevante ervaring (minimaal 2 jaar) in programmeren / scripting (Groovy, Python, Java, Ruby). Kennis van R en Spark zijn een pre; Ervaring met (open-source) omgevingen voor data processing; Vaardig met tools in een Hortonworks omgeving; Nieuwsgierig en creatief; Je bent op de hoogte van de nieuwste technieken van big data; Een proactieve en oplossingsgerichte instelling. Wij belonen jouw inzet met: Een salaris van maximaal €4.700 (bruto op basis van een fulltime werkweek(40u/w), exclusief vakantiegeld); In ieder geval 20 vakantiedagen die je zelf kunt aanvullen met het FlexBudget; Een FlexBudget (minimaal 17,54% van je brutosalaris, met inbegrip van 8% vakantiegeld) waarbij je zelf kan bepalen wat je hiermee doet: extra salaris laten uitbetalen, vrije dagen bijkopen of je pensioen aanvullen; Een goed pensioen bij ABP, waarvan 70% van de premie wordt betaald door Stedin; Zeer uitgebreide trainings- en opleidingsmogelijkheden, we investeren in onze medewerkers; Een goede balans tussen werk en privé; Een laptop en mobiele telefoon. Je kunt ook kiezen voor Bring Your Own Device en zo bijdragen aan onze visie op duurzaamheid; Onbeperkt reizen met openbaar vervoer met een OV vrij-abonnement of een reiskostenvergoeding.

Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of cut flowers, bulbs, tropical plants, pot plants, bedding plants and perennials. For our Research department in De Lier we are looking for a Project Lead Bioinformatics & Data Science. Job objective Our organization grows and flourishes. This results in a fast-changing and, therefore, challenging environment. As a Project Lead Bioinformatics & Data Science you will strengthen our Trait Genetics group which is part of the research department. With your solid background in bioinformatics you will lead projects on the design of algorithms and pipelines using genomic data as well as phenomic data. Your will also wrap up these pipelines into solutions for end-users and be responsible for setting up, developing and maintaining the IT solutions for our Trait Genetics team. Collaboration is an important feature of the job, and you will work closely with scientists within Trait Genetics as well as other expertise groups such as Trait Discovery, Plant Physiology, Phytopathology and Breeding. You will report to the Technology Lead Trait Genetics in De Lier. Your tasks and responsibilities Design, improve and maintain innovative software solutions for large data challenges within research. Lead projects on developing pipelines for computer vision (preprocessing, segmentation, machine learning, deep learning, GAN etc), genomic analyses and routine molecular breeding. Make tools and pipelines available for routine application through automation or for end-users through web-apps or Notebooks. Perform scouting activities for novel tools and technologies. You are expected to collaborate closely with other research teams (mainly Computational Biology, Plant Physiology, Trait Discovery, and Phytopathology) and manage relationships with stakeholders such as Breeding and IT. Your profile PhD in a relevant field in biology with a strong computational focus (for example bioinformatics, applied mathematics, data science) and preferably >2 years experience in industry. You have a thorough understanding of the Linux operating system and are proficient in coding in Python and R (other programming languages are nice to have). Proven experience in large-scaled NGS data analysis and advanced computer vision applications preferably using various deep learning approaches. Experience with DevOps (Kubernetes, Docker), databases (SQL), pipeline tools and workflow management (Snakemake) and cloud computing. Experience with web-apps such as Dash and RShiny is preferred. Ability to work independently as well as in fast-paced multidisciplinary teams. Inquisitive, innovative and critical mind-set and a creative and pro-active attitude. Excellent written and oral communication skills which are tailored to the target audience. Excellent command of English and willingness to learn Dutch. We offer Dümmen Orange has great global ambitions. Innovation, technology and quality are high priorities. This results in a challenging working environment in which you can develop yourself. Dümmen Orange offers its employees plenty of room for personal growth and development. We have an informal and easy accessible working environment in which cooperation is very important. Dümmen Orange Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of flowers and plants. Its annual turnover is about 350 million euro. The company employs over 7.300 employees worldwide. In addition to a large marketing and sales network, Dümmen Orange has a diversified network of specialized production sites. The key to Dümmen Orange’s success is a broad and deep product range, supported by a global supply chain. The company embraces its social responsibilities and invests in the health, safety and personal development of its staff. Your application Click on the button below to apply for this job. If you have questions about the job, you can contact Camillo Berenos (Technology Lead Trait Genetics), via +31 174 530 100. Acquisition with reference to this advertisement will not be appreciated. Founded in 2012 and based in Amsterdam, Owlin turns news into actionable intelligence. Our international client base is growing rapidly, and more prospects come knocking at our door every day. That is why we need a best-in-class Applied Data Scientist to join our team. Instead of sitting in a cubicle in a corporate environment, working at Owlin means that you will be making a visible impact while working in an ambitious, fast-growing team and bringing exciting products to the global financial market.  About the job You will be working in a young and dynamic Data Science Team that aims to deeply understand our clients’ business challenges and build solutions that answer those needs. We leverage cutting edge technologies from NLP and other areas of ML or develop entirely new techniques in-house if need be. Even though deep learning definitely has its place within Owlin, we also particularly value models that can be introspected and adjusted on the spot by data analysts.  About you You are not the type of person that needs or asks for instructions. You are expected to proactively engage with what is already in place and pitch ideas for improvement. You will make sure your ideas are understood, validated, and implemented in practice as well. You have a passion for technology and the way it is changing traditional markets and institutions. You want to be part of that revolution and are looking for an adventurous job where you can make a real difference.  Responsibilities As part of the Data Science Team, you have a central role in extracting value and insights from our data (mostly structured and unstructured text as well as time series data of various kinds) and translate this into new tools and resources for our clients. As an Applied Data Scientist with a Data Engineering Focus, your core objective is to support the team in turning ideas into production-ready models, infrastructure and code. You’ll get your hands dirty on the command line of Linux servers, and help us develop data pipelines both on and off the cloud. If you also possess bona fide research skills, you are more than welcome to let it show. How you develop yourself within Owlin is limited only by your own ambitions and capabilities.  Hard skills 3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist / Engineer Problem solving and analytical thinking Demonstrable programming proficiency Ability to implement algorithms in Python / NumPy Numba / Cython / C(++) / JavaScript (NodeJS) / GO are a bonus Solid understanding of data structures and algorithmic complexity Experience in Deep Learning and ML general (PyTorch / TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, SciPy, ...) Experience in NLP Experience with deploying data-processing pipelines Experience using Linux Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases Familiarity with REST APIs and their deployment (Flask, FastAPI, Nginx, passenger) English: full professional working proficiency We also really appreciate: Strong mathematical and statistical background An intuitive understanding of business problems  Soft skills Authentic and ambitious Entrepreneurial and pragmatic mindset High degree of personal motivation Ability to manage your own schedule Deep care for end users and their experience  Benefits We offer a wide array of perks to help our employees find an ideal work-to-life balance. We’re all about increasing productivity by maximizing joy. Here are some of the benefits that we have to offer: Competitive pay: good primary and secondary benefits Great place to work: a beautiful office with a view right in the city center of tech hub Amsterdam. Great WFH-support to make sure you have all you need to “get shit done”. International team Personal development: surrounded by the best and brightest tech talent Flat hierarchy where your work will directly touch our clients Fun(virtual) company-wide events. Daily lunch and Friday afternoon drinks when things are back to normal! In a (post-)COVID world, we are flexible and accommodating when it comes to working remotely. The office is available for those who need to use it (within limits in line with governmental public health safety guidelines), but the infrastructure and routines are in place to facilitate working remotely for everyone, all while staying engaged, motivated and productive.  If you think this position has your name written all over it, we sincerely hope to hear from you. If so, please submit your resume and motivation letter.

Company Description  We are on a mission to be the easiest and most reliable way to arrange home services, connecting homeowners with qualified service professionals. We operate the market-leading brands in France (Travaux.com) and the Netherlands (Werkspot.nl) and expanding in Italy (Instapro.it). Our Product, Technology & UX department consists of approximately 100 talented professionals, deeply passionate about creating beautiful digital marketplaces.  Job Description  The team The Data Engineering team consists of engineers and a product owner. Our mission is to make reliable data available to the entire organisation. We firmly believe in Agile principles and autonomy. Transparency, ownership and curiosity are our core values. We work in two different locations (Amsterdam, Netherlands and Aix-en-Provence, France) and once it is safe again, we will meet each other face-to-face frequently. As such, the job offer is open in both offices. The role As a Data Engineer at Werkspot, you will be responsible for designing, building and maintaining our data pipeline and data models, keeping scalability in mind. We put an emphasis on data modeling using DBT and the business best practices. We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all employees.  Additional Information  How we are organised: Our Product, Technology and UX department currently consists of 4 tracks and approximately 100 professionals, from all over the world: Brazil, Canada, India, France, Greece, Ireland, Israel, Italy, The Netherlands, South Africa, Paraguay, Poland, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Turkey, the UK, and the USA. Each track focuses on the most valuable opportunity within their given scope. Within the tracks, multidisciplinary product development teams collaborate on achieving the goals that they set and commit to each quarter. We approach our decisions in an experiment-guided and Agile way: we validate new directions using a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methods. Our shared values: We believe our success starts with sharing the same values when it comes to how we work. These values are the foundation of everything we do, and you’ll experience them on a daily basis. Our values are: Be stronger together; Aim high; Take ownership; Be transparent and respectful; Be open-minded and curious; Embrace diversity; Focus on our customers. The company culture in our organisation is very open and inclusive; we are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Special note related to COVID-19 We will be hiring mostly through online video interviews. In-person interviews can be scheduled for candidates in the Amsterdam area, with the agreement of both parties. The position is based in Amsterdam and requires relocation to the Netherlands. Note that in-line with the current government (RIVM) recommendations, we are currently working from home. We will do our best to make the on-boarding as smooth as possible and help you get up-to-speed. Is this for you? Send your resume with a brief explanation of why you are highly motivated by this role. You can apply via the “Apply” button or by sending your information to Samy Bouras, Data Lead at Werkspot, Travaux and Instapro. We’re looking forward to meeting you!

Opleidingsniveau HBO, WO Aantal uren 36 uur Vakgebied Innovatie (IT) Salarisindicatie € 2973 - € 5169 p.m. Solliciteer vóór 30 maart 2021 Contractvorm Onbepaalde tijd Jouw functie Gemeente Rotterdam is flink aan het investeren om onze organisatie meer datagedreven te maken. Ons programma Data Gedreven Werken (DGW) wordt momenteel geïmplementeerd en verder opgeschaald. For FrieslandCampina Research & Development we are looking for an enthusiastic research analyst who would like to join the FrieslandCampina Global Expert Team Nutrition. The Global Expert Team Nutrition focusses on substantiation of the impact of dairy and digestion on health. As part of this team you will be working in our life science laboratory on fermentations, digestions and data analyses. Are you the person who likes to make a difference with science-based in vitro analyses supporting the development of healthy ingredients and end-products? Would you like to work dedicated on the laboratory and collaborate with our life science researchers and scientist on substantiation of health benefits, then please react to this vacancy. What we ask Bachelor degree (HBO/HLO) in Life Sciences or related area At least 5 years work experience in a (business) research environment as (senior) research analyst Practical experience with fermentation and digestion models is preferred Affinity with data science, lab automation and/or programming is considered an asset (e.g. Excel Visual Basics, R, Python) Team player with a hands-on attitude, with the following key competences: accurate, responsible, analytical, eagerness to understand, enthusiastic, dedicated, flexible, result-oriented, structured. What we offer  At FrieslandCampina Corporate R&D, Research Expert Teams are delivering the technological foundations for the development of innovative products and processes within FrieslandCampina. As part of the Global Expert Team Nutrition you will be working in our R&D centre based in Wageningen the Netherlands. In the centre up-to date laboratories are available with state-of-the-art equipment. Within the Global Expert Team Nutrition, you will be part of a team of 6 enthusiastic and dedicated life science research analysts. Het Nivel zoekt op korte termijn een (Senior) Data Scientist/Onderzoeker. Ben jij een ervaren onderzoeker en open-minded data scientist? Het Nivel Werken bij het Nederlands instituut voor onderzoek van de gezondheidszorg (Nivel) betekent dat je hoogwaardig onderzoek doet naar de kwaliteit en effectiviteit van de gezondheidszorg en het eraan gerelateerde sociale domein. Dat doet het Nivel met betrouwbaar en onafhankelijk wetenschappelijk onderzoek dat direct in de praktijk wordt gebruikt. Het Nivel vindt het belangrijk dat de kennis uit onderzoek bijdraagt aan het continu verbeteren en vernieuwen van de gezondheidszorg voor iedereen, het bevorderen van participatie in de samenleving en een duurzaam gezondheidszorgsysteem. ‘Kennis voor betere zorg’ is dan ook haar missie. Bij het Nivel werken circa 160 mensen, waarvan 90 onderzoekers. Kijk voor meer informatie op: https://www.nivel.nl/nl/het-nivel-2-minuten Het cluster Routine Zorgdata Je komt te werken binnen het cluster Routine Zorgdata met ICT-specialisten en relatie beheerders, maar werkt tegelijkertijd nauw samen in de projectteams met onderzoekers. Je bent de linking pin die het verwerken van Big Data en het doen van onderzoek begrijpt en verbindt. Binnen het cluster worden data van 1,7 miljoen patiënten verwerkt. Het gaat om data van huisartsen, huisartsenposten, fysio- en oefentherapie, diëtetiek en logopedie. De routinematig vastgelegde gegevens worden door ICT-specialisten beheerd en beschikbaar gesteld voor wetenschappelijk onderzoek. Per discipline zijn verwerkingsstraten ingericht. Jouw rol Je treedt op als schakel tussen technische en inhoudelijke experts en vertaalt de informatiebehoefte naar nieuwe handvatten voor data-gedreven onderzoek. Dit vraagt zowel technische als communicatieve (verbindende) kwaliteiten. Je bent betrokken bij het onderzoeksproces van verschillende Nivel onderzoeksprogramma’s, van projectacquisitie tot eindpresentatie en nazorg, het meeschrijven aan onderzoeksvoorstellen vanuit je data-science expertise, het verzamelen en verwerken van grote hoeveelheden gegevens uit patiëntendossiers van eerstelijnszorgverleners, het samenstellen van onderzoekbestanden, het opstellen en schatten van (voorspellende) modellen en herkennen van patronen in de data. Je kunt die rol nu al zelfstandig vervullen of je krijgt de mogelijkheid die rol binnen enkele jaren te vervullen, afhankelijk van je huidige ervaring. De projecten waar je samen met onderzoekers aan werkt, zijn afwisselend en divers. The PhD project is a multidisciplinary research project on on-site wireless monitoring of horses for advanced and real-time equine locomotion and performance analysis. The focus is on the validation and clinical application of advanced sensor-based gait analysis and heart rate monitoring that can be used to assess lameness and performance in horses and, potentially, other animal species. The project builds on earlier work and aims principally at the further development of sensor technology for monitoring horses during training and competition. The project is a joint venture between the SLU (Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Uppsala, Sweden) and Utrecht University in the Netherlands. The candidate will be stationed in Utrecht, however frequent travel between the two universities, including longer stays in Sweden, is foreseen.  Working at our gait lab, the candidate will have access to the most advanced technology worldwide for gait analysis in horses, including high-speed and high-resolution wireless IMU sensors, force/pressure plates, 3D optical motion capture, surface EMG and a high-speed treadmill. Our research consortium includes partners in Sweden, Germany, the UK and Switzerland, allowing the candidate to expand her or his working network.  The PhD candidate will work on the development and validation of different modalities of equine gait analysis and will also be involved in the daily activities of the Utrecht Equine Gait Analysis lab. This function includes regular monitoring of orthopaedic patients with advanced gait analysis modalities and use of gait analysis as an outcome parameter for several in-vivo studies.  Profiel We are looking for a candidate with a background in sensor data analytics and embedded computing with a keen interest in animal health care and sport. You have an interest in contributing to a high quality, impactful team of University Researchers, companies and Veterinary Clinicians. Salaries are supplemented with a holiday bonus of 8% and a year-end bonus of 8.3% per year. In addition, Utrecht University offers excellent secondary conditions, including an attractive retirement scheme, (partly paid) parental leave and flexible employment conditions (multiple choice model).
